it's a lot, but seems quite good.
do the paddings need to be exposed in the API?
I put them there because it made it easier for me to iterate the styles. Do you think they should be pruned?
I think we need to decide how far we want to go with the CSS vars
@timja do you agree with this var namespace --bigtable instead --table?

haven't looked as closely as you but why do we need to differentiate tables and bigtables?
Is it because tables are used for layout in many places and big table is actual tabular data?

--table-stripped-bg--hover is used here at least:

Could be changed. I'm open to feedback.
Also, I'm not really sure about inheriting --pane-* styles. It feels right but I don't know how well it scales.
should this be striped not stripped?
Probably yes. It was an existing variable. Changing it.

is this TODO still required?

have you decided which one should be used?
I have decided on using both. I'll use --pane-header-color on table.sortable by default but will override it for bigtables. (See 4527d84)
This rule appears to have caused https://issues.jenkins.io/browse/JENKINS-63636 which makes all progress bars in Jenkins completely useless.
